Key Match Events: Mayank Yadav bowled with a rattling pace in a promising debut.
Varun Chakaravarthy made an impressive comeback.
India bundled out Bangladesh for a below-par 127.
India chased down the target in 11.5 overs.
Arshdeep Singh was the PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his brilliant bowling spell.
Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakaravarthy took three wickets each.
Hardik Pandya stayed unbeaten on 39 off just 16 balls.
Hardik Pandya and Nitish Kumar Reddy finished the job with more than 8 overs to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav appreciated the character and selflessness of the team.
Najmul Hossain Shanto reflected on the need to play well in the Powerplay and adjust according to the situation.
Varun Chakaravarthy expressed that it felt like a rebirth for him to be back in the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in the new stadium in Gwalior.
The 2nd T20I will be played on 9th October in New Delhi at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.
